Oscars In 3 Quotes
==================

> Iam older than the Academy. Iam very proud of that. Just keep moving.”
> 
> Eva Saint Marie, 93-year-old actress presenting at the 90th Academy Award.

Flip For More

card_2.cardText:
Hollywood Legend
================

Eva Saint Marie
---------------

Born: Newark New Jersey, 1924

Winner, Best Supporting Actress, aOn the Waterfronta, 1955 Oscars

Gave birth to her first child, a son, days after she won Academy Award

card_3.cardText:
> “At age 17, I enlisted in the National Guard. A few years later, I volunteered to go to Vietnam. Now I am proud to have served there for 12 months with Alpha Company of the 39th Infantry. (Applause). **Anyone else**?”
> 
> Wes Studi, Actor, introducing films about those "who fought for freedom around the world" 90th Academy Awards

card_4.cardText:
Amazing American:  
Wes Studi
-----------------------------

You know him from: “The Last of The Mohicans” & “Dances With Wolves”

Oklahoma Native – Cherokee (\*may\* be first Native American to present at Oscars)

Only spoke Cherokee language until age 5

card_5.cardText:
> aI have two words for you: ‘**Inclusion Rider**‘.”
> 
> Frances McDormand, during acceptance speech for Best Actress, 90th Academy Awards, March 4, 2018

Flip For What It Means

card_6.cardText:
AKA: “Equity Rider”
-------------------

Some will believe it is a contractual necessity; Others don’t.

“An inclusion rider is a reference to the belief by some that there should be requirements in contracts that provide for gender and racial diversity.” _Hollywood Reporter, March 4, 2018_

[Click Here For Article](https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/what-is-an-inclusion-rider-frances-mcdormands-oscars-speech-explained-1091532)
